sysDevIpFilterConfigTable.name: sysDevIpFilterConfigTable
sysDevIpFilterConfigTable.description: This table allows the user to configure filtering information. Every filter is comprised of a number of rules(see SysDevRuleTable). When a filter is bound to an interface, all the rules of that particular filter apply to that particular interface. Also the same filter maybe bound to several interfaces. This table only allows us to configure information about a particular filter. this table is indexed by sysDevIpFilterName.

sysDevIpFilterConfigTableEntry.name: sysDevIpFilterConfigTableEntry
sysDevIpFilterConfigTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter configuration table.

sysDevIpFilterName.name: sysDevIpFilterName
sysDevIpFilterName.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the name of the filter.

sysDevIpDefFilterAction.name: sysDevIpDefFilterAction
sysDevIpDefFilterAction.description: The value of this object corresponds to the default action taken on a particular IP packet based on the filter rule. forward - the packet is forwarded discard - the packet is discarded. delete - the rule of a particular filter or the filter as a whole is deleted.

sysDevIpFilterNumOfDynamicRules.name: sysDevIpFilterNumOfDynamicRules
sysDevIpFilterNumOfDynamicRules.description: This object corresponds to the number of dynamic rules configured for this filter

sysDevIpFilterNumOfStaticRules.name: sysDevIpFilterNumOfStaticRules
sysDevIpFilterNumOfStaticRules.description: This object corresponds to the number of static rules configured for this filter

sysDevIpFilterRefCount.name: sysDevIpFilterRefCount
sysDevIpFilterRefCount.description: This object corresponds to the number of references for this filter by the various interfaces of the system For Example if filter 'abc' is bound to two of the DSL interfaces as input filters. then the reference count for this filter is 2. if a filter 'def' is bound to the 10BaseT interface as both an input and an output filter. The reference count for this filter would be 2. Filters can be deleted from the system (by a user) only if the reference count equals 0

sysDevIpFilterTcpAckFilterAction.name: sysDevIpFilterTcpAckFilterAction
sysDevIpFilterTcpAckFilterAction.description: The value of this object corresponds to the default action taken on the first TCP ACK packet of the TCP connection. This object is not supported for MCC.

sysDevIpFilterDhcpFilterAction.name: sysDevIpFilterDhcpFilterAction
sysDevIpFilterDhcpFilterAction.description: The value of this object corresponds to the default action taken on the DHCP transaction messages. This object is not supported for mcc.

sysDevIpFilterRowStatus.name: sysDevIpFilterRowStatus
sysDevIpFilterRowStatus.description: The object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevIpFilterRuleConfigTable.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleConfigTable
sysDevIpFilterRuleConfigTable.description: This table allows the user to configure the rules of each IP filter. When a filter is bound to an interface, all the rules of that particular filter apply to that particular interface. Also, the same filter may be found to several interfaces. This table is indexed by sysDevIpFilterName and sysDevIpFilterRuleNumber.

sysDevIpFilterRuleConfigTableEntry.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleConfigTableEntry
sysDevIpFilterRuleConfigTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter rule configuration table.

sysDevIpRuleFilterName.name: sysDevIpRuleFilterName
sysDevIpRuleFilterName.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the name of the filter.

sysDevIpFilterRuleNumber.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleNumber
sysDevIpFilterRuleNumber.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to a rule within a particular filter. If the value of this object is 0, then the sets apply to the filter as a whole. For example one may want to delete the whole filter. for a get only the name of the filter is returned.

sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddress.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddress
sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddress.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to an source IP Address. This object could be set if IP packets need to be filtered based on where it is coming from. Setting this object to 0.0.0.0 disables source IP address comparison.

sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddrMask.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddrMask
sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddrMask.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to an source IP Address Mask. The value of this object is bitwise anded with the source address within the IP packet and then compared with the sysDevIPFilterSrcAddress.

sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddrCompEnable.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddrCompEnable
sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcAddrCompEnable.description: This object enables or disables the source address comparison. It is not supported for MCC.

sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcPortNum.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcPortNum
sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcPortNum.description: The UDP or TCP port number of the source on which this filter is applied.

sysDevIpFilterRuleMaxSrcPortNum.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleMaxSrcPortNum
sysDevIpFilterRuleMaxSrcPortNum.description: The maximum UDP or TCP port number of the source on which this filter is applied. This object is valid only if the source comparison type is in-range or out-range

sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcCompType.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcCompType
sysDevIpFilterRuleSrcCompType.description: The value of this object corresponds to the type of comparison which is to be made for source based filtering for the particular rule of the filter. none - no comparison is to be made. eq - equal to neq - not equal to gt - greater than lt - less than inRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet is within a specified range. outRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet lies outside a specified range.

sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddress.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddress
sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddress.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to an destination IP Address. This object could be set if IP packets need to be filtered based on where it is going to.

sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddrMask.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddrMask
sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddrMask.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to an destination IP Address Mask. The value of this object is bitwise anded with the destination address within the IP packet and then compared with the sysDevIPFilterRuleDestAddress

sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddrCompEnable.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddrCompEnable
sysDevIpFilterRuleDestAddrCompEnable.description: This object enables or disables the destination address comparison. It is not supported for MCC.

sysDevIpFilterRuleDestPortNum.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleDestPortNum
sysDevIpFilterRuleDestPortNum.description: The UDP or TCP port number of the destination on which this filter is applied

sysDevIpFilterRuleMaxDestPortNum.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleMaxDestPortNum
sysDevIpFilterRuleMaxDestPortNum.description: The maximum UDP or TCP port number of the destination on which this filter is applied. This object is valid only if the destination comparison type is in-range or out-range

sysDevIpFilterRuleDestCompType.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleDestCompType
sysDevIpFilterRuleDestCompType.description: The value of this object corresponds to the type of comparison which is to be made for destination based filtering for the particular rule of the filter. none - no comparison is to be made. eq - equal to neq - not equal to gt - greater than lt - less than inRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet is within a specified range. outRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet lies outside a specified range.

sysDevIpFilterRuleType.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleType
sysDevIpFilterRuleType.description: The value of this object corresponds to the type of type of rule configured static - This indicates that the rule was configured by an NMS either by SNMP, console or using telnet dynamic - this indicates that the rule was configured by the the system for end-users who have obtaimed an IP address using the DHCP protocol.

sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeUdp.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeUdp
sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeUdp.description: The value of this object corresponds to the action taken on a particular UDP packet based on the source/ destination port comparison rule.

sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeTcp.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeTcp
sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeTcp.description: The value of this object corresponds to the action taken on a particular TCP packet bases on the source/ destination port comparison rule.

sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeIcmp.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeIcmp
sysDevIpFilterRuleProtocolTypeIcmp.description: The value of this object corresponds to the action taken on a particular ICMP packet bases on the protocol type comparison rule.

sysDevIpFilterRuleRowStatus.name: sysDevIpFilterRuleRowStatus
sysDevIpFilterRuleRowStatus.description: The object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevMaxNumOfInputIpFilters.name: sysDevMaxNumOfInputIpFilters
sysDevMaxNumOfInputIpFilters.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the max number of input IP filters supported by each device.

sysDevMaxNumOfOutputIpFilters.name: sysDevMaxNumOfOutputIpFilters
sysDevMaxNumOfOutputIpFilters.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the max number of Output IP filters supported by each device.

sysDevIpFilterBindingTable.name: sysDevIpFilterBindingTable
sysDevIpFilterBindingTable.description: This table allows us to bind filters to a particular interface. As such this table is doubly indexed by ifIndex and sysDevIpBindingFilterName.

sysDevIpFilterBindingTableEntry.name: sysDevIpFilterBindingTableEntry
sysDevIpFilterBindingTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter binding table.

sysDevIpBindingFilterName.name: sysDevIpBindingFilterName
sysDevIpBindingFilterName.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the name of the filter.

sysDevIpBindingFilterType.name: sysDevIpBindingFilterType
sysDevIpBindingFilterType.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the type of the filter which needs to be bound to a particular interface. inputFilter - This indicates that the filter is applied to the packets coming in to the interface. outputFilter - this indicates that the filter is applied to packets going out the interface. inputOutputFilter - this indicates that the filter is applied packets going out the interface and to packets coming in to the interface.

sysDevIpBindingFilterRowStatus.name: sysDevIpBindingFilterRowStatus
sysDevIpBindingFilterRowStatus.description: This object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevIpFilterSNBindingTable.name: sysDevIpFilterSNBindingTable
sysDevIpFilterSNBindingTable.description: This table allows us to bind filters to a particular interface on portcards. This table is indexed by ifIndex, sysDevIpSNBindingVnidId and sysDevIpSNBindingFilterName.

sysDevIpFilterSNBindingTableEntry.name: sysDevIpFilterSNBindingTableEntry
sysDevIpFilterSNBindingTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the SNfilter binding table.

sysDevIpSNBindingVnidId.name: sysDevIpSNBindingVnidId
sysDevIpSNBindingVnidId.description: The VNID Id number of the virtual network to which this filter is bound.

sysDevIpSNBindingFilterName.name: sysDevIpSNBindingFilterName
sysDevIpSNBindingFilterName.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the name of the filter.

sysDevIpSNBindingFilterType.name: sysDevIpSNBindingFilterType
sysDevIpSNBindingFilterType.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the type of the filter which needs to be bound to a particular interface. inputFilter - This indicates that the filter is applied to the packets coming in to the interface. outputFilter - this indicates that the filter is applied to packets going out the interface. inputOutputFilter - this indicates that the filter is applied packets going out the interface and to packets coming in to the interface.

sysDevIpSNBindingFilterRowStatus.name: sysDevIpSNBindingFilterRowStatus
sysDevIpSNBindingFilterRowStatus.description: This object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevIpInputPacketsFiltered.name: sysDevIpInputPacketsFiltered
sysDevIpInputPacketsFiltered.description: The number of IP packets that have been filtered on all the incoming interfaces due to not matching programmed filter entries on interfaces that are activated for IP filtering.This is supported on MCC only

sysDevIpOutputPacketsFiltered.name: sysDevIpOutputPacketsFiltered
sysDevIpOutputPacketsFiltered.description: The number of IP packets that have been filtered on all the outgoing interfaces due to not matching programmed filter entries on interfaces that are activated for IP filtering.This is supported on MCC only

sysDevSNInjectionType.name: sysDevSNInjectionType
sysDevSNInjectionType.description: The value of this object corresponds to the remote injection type

sysDevSNInjectionVnid.name: sysDevSNInjectionVnid
sysDevSNInjectionVnid.description: This object corresponds to the vnid id (bound to an interface) on which filter injection is not supported or has failed

sysDevFilterConfigTable.name: sysDevFilterConfigTable
sysDevFilterConfigTable.description: This table allows the user to configure filtering information. Every filter is comprised of a number of rules(see SysDevRuleTable). When a filter is bound to an interface, all the rules of that particular filter apply to that particular interface. Also the same filter maybe bound to several interfaces. This table only allows us to configure information about a particular filter. this table is indexed by sysDevFilterName.

sysDevFilterConfigTableEntry.name: sysDevFilterConfigTableEntry
sysDevFilterConfigTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter configuration table.

sysDevFilterIndex.name: sysDevFilterIndex
sysDevFilterIndex.description: The value of this object is an index of the filter. This object is used by sysDevFilterConfigTable to identify the row in the table. When creating new row of this table the value of this object may be obtained by retreiving the value of sysDevFilterIndexNext.

sysDevFilterName.name: sysDevFilterName
sysDevFilterName.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the name of the filter.

sysDevFilterType.name: sysDevFilterType
sysDevFilterType.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the type of the filter. Ethernet is layer 2 filter, Ip are layer 3 filters (include layer 4 protocol filtering).

sysDevDefFilterAction.name: sysDevDefFilterAction
sysDevDefFilterAction.description: The value of this object corresponds to the default action taken on a particular IP packet based on the filter rule. forward - the packet is forwarded discard - the packet is discarded.

sysDevFilterNumOfDynamicRules.name: sysDevFilterNumOfDynamicRules
sysDevFilterNumOfDynamicRules.description: This object corresponds to the number of dynamic rules configured for this filter. Default is zero.

sysDevFilterNumOfStaticRules.name: sysDevFilterNumOfStaticRules
sysDevFilterNumOfStaticRules.description: This object corresponds to the number of static rules configured for this filter. Default is zero

sysDevFilterRefCount.name: sysDevFilterRefCount
sysDevFilterRefCount.description: This object corresponds to the number of references for this filter by the various interfaces of the system For Example if filter 'abc' is bound to two of the DSL interfaces as inbound filter then the reference count for this filter is 2. Filters can be deleted from the system (by a user) only if the reference count equals 0. (the filter is not bound to any interfaces). The default is 0.

sysDevFilterRowStatus.name: sysDevFilterRowStatus
sysDevFilterRowStatus.description: The object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevL2FilterRuleConfigTable.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleConfigTable
sysDevL2FilterRuleConfigTable.description: This table allows the user to configure the rules of each IP filter. When a filter is bound to an interface, all the rules of that particular filter apply to that particular interface. Also, the same filter may be found to several interfaces. This table is indexed by sysDevL2FilterRuleIndex.

sysDevL2FilterRuleConfigTableEntry.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleConfigTableEntry
sysDevL2FilterRuleConfigTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter rule configuration table.

sysDevL2FilterRuleIndex.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleIndex
sysDevL2FilterRuleIndex.description: The value of this object is an index of the filter rule table. This object is used by sysDevFilterConfigTable to identify the row in the table. When creating new row of this table the value of this object may be obtained by retreiving the value of sysDevL2FilterRuleIndexNext.

sysDevL2FilterRuleName.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleName
sysDevL2FilterRuleName.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the name of the rule.

sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherFrameType.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherFrameType
sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherFrameType.description: This value descirbes if Ethernet frame types defined that can be transmitted.

sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherType.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherType
sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherType.description: This value descirbes if Ethernet types defined in RFC1700 are specified as range or one single type. It is possible to create rule using a range of types and therefore next object is added to create start of the range.This object is the first in range and the value of it has to be smaller or equal to a hex Ethernet type value entered in sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeEnds. If this object specifies that the value used is a single type than sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeEnds will not be considered valid.

sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeStarts.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeStarts
sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeStarts.description: This value corresponds to Ethernet types defined in RFC1700. It is possible to create rule using a range of types and therefore next object is added to create range. This object is the first in range and the value of it has to be smaller or equal to a hex Ethernet type value entered next. If the value of sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherType is singleType(2) then only this value is considered.

sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeEnds.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeEnds
sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherTypeRangeEnds.description: This value corresponds to Ethernet types defined in RFC1700. It is possible to create rule using a range of types and therefore this object is added to create range. This object is the second value in the range. The value of it has to be larger or equal to a hex Ethernet type value entered previously. This object is not considered valid if the value of sysDevL2FilterRuleEtherType is singleType(2).

sysDevL2FilterRuleAction.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleAction
sysDevL2FilterRuleAction.description: The value of this object specify the action to be done if the rule is matched to a packet.

sysDevL2FilterRuleRowStatus.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleRowStatus
sysDevL2FilterRuleRowStatus.description: The object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevL3FilterRuleConfigTable.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleConfigTable
sysDevL3FilterRuleConfigTable.description: This table allows the user to configure the rules for layer three filter. When a filter is bound to an interface, all the rules of that particular filter apply to the specified interface. Also, the same filter may be bound to several interfaces. This table is indexed by sysDevL3FilterRuleIndex.

sysDevL3FilterRuleConfigTableEntry.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleConfigTableEntry
sysDevL3FilterRuleConfigTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter rule configuration table.

sysDevL3FilterRuleIndex.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleIndex
sysDevL3FilterRuleIndex.description: The value of this object is an index of the filter rule table. This object is used by sysDevFilterConfigTable to identify the row in the table. When creating new row of this table the value of this object may be obtained by retreiving the value of sysDevL3FilterRuleIndexNext.

sysDevL3FilterRuleName.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleName
sysDevL3FilterRuleName.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the name of the rule. It is highly recommended that the RuleName be unique user friendly name.

sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddress.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddress
sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddress.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to a source IP Address. This object could be set if IP packets need to be filtered based on where it is coming from. Setting this object to 0.0.0.0 disables source IP address comparison.

sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddrMask.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddrMask
sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddrMask.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to an source IP Address Mask. The value of this object is bitwise anded with the source address within the IP packet.

sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddrAction.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddrAction
sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcAddrAction.description: This object specifies action taken with the source address filtering. If the selection allows any SrcAddr (effectively ignoring this filed) than 'none' (3) is valid choice for this object.

sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcPortNum.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcPortNum
sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcPortNum.description: The UDP or TCP port number of the source on which this filter is applied. This object is used as a start of range if the source comparison type is in-range or out-range.

sysDevL3FilterRuleMaxSrcPortNum.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleMaxSrcPortNum
sysDevL3FilterRuleMaxSrcPortNum.description: The maximum UDP or TCP port number of the source on which this filter is applied. This object is valid only if the source comparison type is in-range or out-range

sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcCompType.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcCompType
sysDevL3FilterRuleSrcCompType.description: The value of this object corresponds to the type of comparison which is to be made for source based filtering for the particular rule of the filter. none - no comparison is to be made. eq - equal to neq - not equal to gt - greater than lt - less than inRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet is within a specified range. outRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet lies outside a specified range.

sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddress.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddress
sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddress.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to an destination IP Address. This object could be set if IP packets need to be filtered based on where it is going to.

sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddrMask.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddrMask
sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddrMask.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to an destination IP Address Mask. The value of this object is bitwise anded with the destination address within the IP packet.

sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddrAction.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddrAction
sysDevL3FilterRuleDestAddrAction.description: This object specifies action taken for destination address filtering. If the selection allows any DestAddr (effectively ignoring this filed) than 'none' (3) is valid choice for this object.

sysDevL3FilterRuleDestPortNum.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleDestPortNum
sysDevL3FilterRuleDestPortNum.description: The UDP or TCP port number of the destination on which this filter is applied. This object is used as a start of range if the source comparison type is in-range or out-range.

sysDevL3FilterRuleMaxDestPortNum.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleMaxDestPortNum
sysDevL3FilterRuleMaxDestPortNum.description: The maximum UDP or TCP port number of the destination on which this filter is applied. This object is valid only if the destination comparison type is in-range or out-range

sysDevL3FilterRuleDestCompType.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleDestCompType
sysDevL3FilterRuleDestCompType.description: The value of this object corresponds to the type of comparison which is to be made for destination based filtering for the particular rule of the filter. none - no comparison is to be made. eq - equal to neq - not equal to gt - greater than lt - less than inRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet is within a specified range. outRange - the source port number of the TCP or UDP packet lies outside a specified range.

sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeUdp.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeUdp
sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeUdp.description: The value of this object corresponds to the action taken on a particular UDP packet based on the source/ destination port comparison rule. If the selection allows any Udp packet (effectively ignoring this filed) than 'none' (3) is valid choice for this object.

sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeTcp.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeTcp
sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeTcp.description: The value of this object corresponds to the action taken on a particular TCP packet bases on the source/ destination port comparison rule. If the selection allows any Tcp packet (effectively ignoring this filed) than 'none' (3) is valid choice for this object.

sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeIcmp.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeIcmp
sysDevL3FilterRuleProtocolTypeIcmp.description: The value of this object corresponds to the action taken on a particular ICMP packet bases on the protocol type comparison rule. If the selection allows any Icmp packet (effectively ignoring this filed) than 'none' (3) is valid choice for this object.

sysDevL3FilterRuleRowStatus.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleRowStatus
sysDevL3FilterRuleRowStatus.description: The object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevFilterBindingTable.name: sysDevFilterBindingTable
sysDevFilterBindingTable.description: This table allows us to bind filters to a particular interface. As such this table is indexed by ifIndex, and by sysDevFilterBindingIndex.

sysDevFilterBindingTableEntry.name: sysDevFilterBindingTableEntry
sysDevFilterBindingTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter binding table.

sysDevFilterBindingIndex.name: sysDevFilterBindingIndex
sysDevFilterBindingIndex.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the filter index from sysDevFilterConfigTable.

sysDevFilterBindingDirection.name: sysDevFilterBindingDirection
sysDevFilterBindingDirection.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the type of the filter which needs to be bound to a particular interface. inboundFilter - This indicates that the filter is applied to the packets coming in to the interface. outboundFilter - this indicates that the filter is applied to packets going out the interface. inboundOutboundFilter - this indicates that the filter is applied packets going out the interface and to packets coming in to the interface.

sysDevFilterBindingAdminStatus.name: sysDevFilterBindingAdminStatus
sysDevFilterBindingAdminStatus.description: The value of this is used to configure admin status of filter binding. If admin status is up(1) that means that the binding is active. If the status is down(2) it means that this binding is inactive for specified interface. If the filter is bound to more than one interface the binings on the other interfaces will have to be configured separately. To read this object use sysDevFilterBindingOperStatus.

sysDevFilterBindingOperStatus.name: sysDevFilterBindingOperStatus
sysDevFilterBindingOperStatus.description: The value of this is used to read oper status of filter binding. If oper status is up(1) that means that the binding is active. If the status is down(2) it means that this binding is inactive for specified interface. To configure this object use sysDevFilterBindingAdminStatus.

sysDevFilterBindingRowStatus.name: sysDevFilterBindingRowStatus
sysDevFilterBindingRowStatus.description: This object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevFilterToRuleBindingTable.name: sysDevFilterToRuleBindingTable
sysDevFilterToRuleBindingTable.description: This table allows us to bind filters to a particular rules. As such this table is indexed by sysDevFilterToRuleBindingIndex, and by sysDevL2FilterIndex.

sysDevFilterToRuleBindingTableEntry.name: sysDevFilterToRuleBindingTableEntry
sysDevFilterToRuleBindingTableEntry.description: Describes a specific entry of the filter binding table.

sysDevFilterToRuleBindingIndex.name: sysDevFilterToRuleBindingIndex
sysDevFilterToRuleBindingIndex.description: The value of this object corresponds directly to the rule index from sysDevL2FilterRuleTable.

sysDevFilterToRulePriority.name: sysDevFilterToRulePriority
sysDevFilterToRulePriority.description: Internally the table will be sorted based on this object- in the increasing order of priority. The highest priority being 1. The table cannot be created without rules being specified. The table lookups will be done on the sorted table.

sysDevFilterToRuleBindingRowStatus.name: sysDevFilterToRuleBindingRowStatus
sysDevFilterToRuleBindingRowStatus.description: This object is used to add or delete a row from this table.

sysDevFilterIndexNext.name: sysDevFilterIndexNext
sysDevFilterIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for sysDevFilterConfigTable. The value of 0 indicates that no unassigned entries are available. To obtain sysDevFilterIndex value for the new entry the manager issues a management protocol retrieval operation to obtain a current value of this object. After each retrieval, the agent must modify the value to the next unassigned index to prevent assignment of the same value to multiple management systems. A management systems should repeat the read to obtain a new value should an attempt to create the new row using previously returned index fail. As this is a scalar object if the mib walk is done on this object it would return the next unused value.

sysDevL2FilterRuleIndexNext.name: sysDevL2FilterRuleIndexNext
sysDevL2FilterRuleIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for sysDevL2FilterRuleConfigTable. The value of 0 indicates that no unassigned entries are available. To obtain sysDevL2FilterRuleIndex value for the new entry the manager issues a management protocol retrieval operation to obtain a current value of this object. After each retrieval, the agent must modify the value to the next unassigned index to prevent assignment of the same value to multiple management systems. A management systems should repeat the read to obtain a new value should an attempt to create the new row using previously returned index fail. As this is a scalar object if the mib walk is done on this object it would return the next unused value.

sysDevL3FilterRuleIndexNext.name: sysDevL3FilterRuleIndexNext
sysDevL3FilterRuleIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for sysDevL3FilterRuleConfigTable. The value of 0 indicates that no unassigned entries are available. To obtain sysDevL3FilterRuleIndex value for the new entry the manager issues a management protocol retrieval operation to obtain a current value of this object. After each retrieval, the agent must modify the value to the next unassigned index to prevent assignment of the same value to multiple management systems. A management systems should repeat the read to obtain a new value should an attempt to create the new row using previously returned index fail. As this is a scalar object if the mib walk is done on this object it would return the next unused value.

sysDevSNInjectionFailureTrap.name: sysDevSNInjectionFailureTrap
sysDevSNInjectionFailureTrap.description: This trap signifies that the injection of filters to SN failed It is of warning class

sysDevSNInjectionIncompatibleTrap.name: sysDevSNInjectionIncompatibleTrap
sysDevSNInjectionIncompatibleTrap.description: This trap signifies that the injection of filters is not supported by the SN. It is of warning class
